rows.title: Your child as a 20-year-old
rows.outro_text: It is important to involve both men and women in raising a child.

rows.title: Stages of child development
rows.intro_text: We are going to explore the basic developmental needs and behaviors of children 0-17 years.

rows.title: When we do not pay attention
rows.outro_text: Just like adults, children like attention. When you do not give children enough attention, they will behave and act in a way that draws your attention. You must try to pay attention to your children and be interested in the things they are doing.

rows.title: Too much control
rows.outro_text: It is good practice for parents to be involved in their children’s play but this should be done respectfully with the full consent of the child. Play should meet the needs of the child and not the parents; thus play the child’s way and not the parent’s way.

rows.title: Interactive play with children
rows.intro_text: Children must have uninterrupted time to play in order to learn and gain life skills. Here are 2 scenarios and reflection activities that will help understand and support children’s play:
rows.outro_text: Play promotes every aspect of children’s development – physical, social, emotional and cognitive.

rows.title: Managing difficult behavior
rows.intro_text: Here is a comic that illustrates a mother reinforcing behavior, followed by an activity:
rows.outro_text:
* Humbly, Sarah was trying to get her brother to play with her.
* Instead of the mother encouraging them to enjoy the play together, she made it worse by shouting at her daughter Sarah. This is common in our everyday lives.
* As parents, we tend to favor the young ones at the expense of the older ones.
* The mother needed to resolve the problem between the two siblings instead of referring the issue to their father.
* She needed to help the children to play together happily.

rows.title: Setting limits for our children
rows.intro_text: Here is a comic illustrating a scenario of a parent setting limits for her child, and some questions:
rows.outro_text:
Notice:
* The mother sits with the child at the same level and communicates the limit. It’s a respectful position where both people are ready to listen.
* The limit should be for a specific behaviour to ensure that Sam abides to the limit. A watch is provided so that they can refer to it.
* Just like the mother, we need to appreciate the children when they follow family rules and limits to encourage them to keep following them.
